inclusion.criterion: Participant is a male between 18 and 65 years of age inclusive
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Severe watery diarrhea without fecal blood of less than 48 hours (with passage of 3 or more watery stools in the 24 hours before admission)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Signs of severe dehydration as per ICDDR,B guidelines (modified WHO guideline)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Dipstick test/Dark-field examination positive for Vibrio cholera
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Participant is willing and able to comply with all trial requirements
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Evidence or history of any clinically significant illness as per the Investigator's discretion.
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Known case of HIV or Hepatitis B
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Frequent excessive alcohol use, binge drinking (e.g. men consume 5 or more drinks in about 2 hours) or use of illicit drugs within the past two years
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: History of receiving antimicrobial or anti-diarrheal medication (loperamide, diphenoxylate, etc.) within seven days of admission
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Donated blood or plasma or experienced clinically significant loss of blood within eight weeks prior to admission or who plan to donate blood within 1 month after study participation
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient has severe watery diarrhea, dehydration, and a positive dark-field microscopy for V. cholerae. However, they have a history of clinically significant illness (dizziness and severe diarrhea) which may trigger exclusion.
